		<item>
		<title>NASA conducting experiments at Olympics during Pyeongchang 2018</title>
		<link>https://globalnews.ca/news/4018258/nasa-experiments-olympics-pyeongchang/</link>
		<comments>https://globalnews.ca/news/4018258/nasa-experiments-olympics-pyeongchang/#respond</comments>
		<pubDate>Sat, 10 Feb 2018 21:56:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Jessica Vomiero]]></dc:creator>
				<category><![CDATA[Environment]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[News]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Science]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[World]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA experiments]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA Olympics]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[NASA Pyeongchang 2018]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Olympic Games]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[PyeongChang]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[PyeongChang 2018]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Winter Games]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[Winter Games 2018]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://globalnews.ca/?p=4018258</guid>
		<description><![CDATA[Scientists from around the globe will come together during the Winter Games to conduct studies on snowfall, with the goal of eventually predicting when it's going to snow. ]]></description>
			<p>
			<img src="https://shawglobalnews.files.wordpress.com/2018/02/forecastpoints_720.gif?w=720&h=480&crop=1" alt="NASA’s observations and experimental, real-time snow forecasts will be made at 16 different points near Olympic event venues every six hours and then relayed to Olympic officials. The NASA-Unified Weather Research Forecast Model (NU-WRF) is one of five real-time research forecast models being used in ICE-POP."/>
		</p>
				<p>
			<img src="https://shawglobalnews.files.wordpress.com/2018/02/nasamodel_1080.gif?w=720&h=480&crop=1" alt="The NASA-Unified Weather Research Forecast Model (NU-WRF) is one of five real-time research forecast models being used in ICE-POP. The animation is a NU-WRF model output that shows a snow event on Jan. 14, 2018 in South Korea."/>
		</p>
					<content:encoded><![CDATA[Scientists from around the globe will come together during the Winter Games to conduct studies on snowfall, with the goal of eventually predicting when it's going to snow. ]]></content:encoded>
